column4: lets see: ubuntu 5.04, 2.6.10-5-386 kernel and a frigging Conexant HSFi winmodem. i can dial but the pppd dies before getting the dns with "code 16, a modem hung up the phone". hints appreciated
You have the driver from Linuxant?
yup
Probably a stupid question, but you have the one that matches your kernel version?
the very one :)
What are you using to dial?
wvdial
d***.  So far you've pretty much echoed the setup I've used successfully on two different computers.  I was hoping you'd answer something differently.
i am very very tempted to run outside and get a hardware modem for this one but that would mean i would have to go outside which is always scary
Phone a friend, and have them order one for you online!
or i could always get on a bike and scoot off to zeer rangsit real quick, it is around the corner for me a couple of more days
Whatever floats your boat I guess.
heh... actually i would like to make this one work without having to get another modem. works nicely on "the other operating system" and dials nicely on the real os but the pppd pains me
Tried reinstalling the driver?
augh. dpkg --remove && dpkg --install? or just a dpkg-reconfigure?
Try reconf first, and go from there.
lets give it a whack. /me gets a bigger hammer
hmm.. could it be that the snd-intel8x0m and snd-atiixp-modem getting overridden by hsfmc97ich and hsfmc97sis have something to do with the code 16? enter the snd modules in the banlist, perhaps?
Worth a shot.
does ubuntu have the banlist in some strange place? ;)
I wouldn't know, sorry.
/etc/timezone, but rather thhan editing it directly I believe the proper way is to use 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure tzdata'.
thanks. and true but i am not going to edit it, just to get some information from it :)
